com.powerup.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.powerup.logic.Game

  • public final class Game
extends Object
    Primary logic class; everything is set up and accessed from here.
    Since:
    2014-01-22
    Author:
    Oliver Lewisohn

      Sets up the board, market and players.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Sets up the board, market and players.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer(int i)
        Returns a player based on the given ID.

        The IDs run from 0 to 3, with 0 being the player who had the first turn.

        Parameters:
        i - The ID of the player to be fetched
        Returns:
        The player in question.

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()

      • getMarket

        public Market getMarket()

      • getWindow

      • start

        public void start()
        Launches the graphical user interface with the "start" frame.

      • setUp

        public void setUp(GameFrame gFrame)
        Launches the primary game window and runs some setup methods.
        Parameters:
        gFrame - The frame of the window.

      • newTurn

        public void newTurn(int n)
        Starts a new turn of the game.
        Parameters:
        n - The ID of the player whose turn it is.

      • getTurn

        public Turn getTurn()

      • end

        public void end()
        Ends the game.

        Re-sorts the list of players by their total cash and shows the results dialog, where they are revealed in order from least cash to most.
